Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: paired hook maeander pattern at rim; painted decoration consisting of goose (only part of head remaining), to right; pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pls 20-1, nos 236-7).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 16)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 234, no. 129)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0169) (phase 2)
